articles.author: Luke Baker
articles.title: Iran won't target Strait of Hormuz over Soleimani killing - analysts
articles.description: Iran is unlikely to block the Strait of Hormuz, the world's busiest oil-shipping channel, in reprisal for the killing of Qassem Soleimani for fear of aggravating its Gulf allies and China, regional analysts said on Monday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Iran is unlikely to block the Strait of Hormuz, the world’s busiest oil-shipping channel, in reprisal for the killing of Qassem Soleimani for fear of aggravating its Gulf allies and China, regional analysts said on Monday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Fed's Rosengren says phase 1 China trade deal won't eliminate concerns
articles.description: The phase one trade deal with China is unlikely to put an end to the era of uncertainty around tariffs that has been putting a damper on U.S. business investment, Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren said on Monday.
articles.content: HARTFORD, Conn (Reuters) - The phase one trade deal with China is unlikely to put an end to the era of uncertainty around tariffs that has been putting a damper on U.S. business investment, Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren said on Monday. … [+620 chars]

articles.title: Democrat Cory Booker drops out of 2020 U.S. presidential race
articles.description: U.S. Senator Cory Booker, an African-American candidate who had recently bemoaned the increasingly lack of diversity in the Democratic presidential field, on Monday said he was ending his White House campaign.
articles.content:
DES MOINES, Iowa (Reuters) - U.S. Senator Cory Booker, an African-American candidate who had recently bemoaned the increasingly lack of diversity in the Democratic presidential field, on Monday said he was ending his White House campaign.

articles.author: Gilles Guillaume
articles.title: Renault shares fall on worries Nissan alliance doomed without Ghosn
articles.description: Renault shares hit six-year lows on Monday as investors worried the French automaker's 20-year cost-sharing alliance with Nissan <7201.T> is headed for a break-up without Carlos Ghosn to hold it together.
articles.content:
PARIS/TOKYO (Reuters) - Renault (RENA.PA) shares hit six-year lows on Monday as investors worried the French automaker’s 20-year cost-sharing alliance with Nissan (7201.T) is headed for a break-up without Carlos Ghosn to hold it together.

articles.title: UK keeping security of Tehran embassy under review: Raab
articles.description: Britain is keeping the security of its embassy in Tehran under review after Iran briefly arrested London's envoy to the country, foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Monday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain is keeping the security of its embassy in Tehran under review after Iran briefly arrested London’s envoy to the country, foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Monday.

articles.title: Poland hit by another bird flu outbreak on goose farm
articles.description: A new outbreak of bird flu was reported in Poland on Monday, with around 6,000 geese now set to be exterminated, a regional spokesman confirmed to Reuters, adding to about half a dozen cases already detected across the country since December.

articles.title: India orders antitrust probe of Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart

articles.title: Robert Abela sworn in as Malta's new prime minister
